column4: you may want to disable the splash screen to see whats actualy going on
I think the grub is already partly installed during a previous install that went wrong.
that thing is totaly unrelated to your problem
or do you have ubuntu installed allready?
it is related, because it exaclty the error I get
I think my situation is as follows: HD with windows XP, Pendrive with ubuntu and a broken GRUB
& Black_Prince: my internal cd-drive is broken, that's why I use a pendrive
whats is that hdd? sata ide scsi?
The build in Disk Utility of Ubuntu
it probably has some of its partitions mounted
but I can;t see to unmount it
if you open a terminal does the mount command show any mounted filesystems on that disk?
also are you sure its the disk and not the stick?
yeah, my disk is 40gb and the usb only 4gb. I want to unmount the harddisk
did you try the lsof on the mountpoint? alternatively you can just write a new partitiontable with fdisk and reboot from the stick
